title: 112_s1225
content: The Act is titled the "Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for clarity. The Act titled the "Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act" defines key terms such as District, Forbearance Agreement, Project, Repayment Contract, and Secretary. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The term "Transfer Agreement" refers to the agreement titled "Memorandum of Agreement between the United States and the Fort Sumner Irrigation District Concerning Principles and Elements of Proposed Transfer of Title to Fort Sumner Irrigation District Facilities" numbered 11-WC-40-406. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE. The Secretary is authorized to convey all right and title of the United States in the Project to the District, subject to existing rights and costs shared between the parties. Compliance with environmental laws is required during the conveyance process. The Secretary is authorized to convey all right and title of the United States in the Project to the District, subject to existing rights and costs shared between the parties. Compliance with environmental laws, including the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 and the Endangered Species Act of 1973, is required during the conveyance process. If the conveyance is not completed within one year, a report must be submitted to Congress explaining the reasons for the delay. If the conveyance of the Project to the District is not completed within one year, a report must be submitted to Congress that explains the reasons for the delay and states the new completion date. SEC. 4. LIABILITY. The United States will no longer be responsible for operating or maintaining the Project after conveyance, except for damages caused by acts committed before the conveyance. This section does not increase the liability of the United States beyond what is provided under the Federal Tort Claims Act. SEC. 5. TERMINATION OF REPAYMENT CONTRACT. SEC. 5. TERMINATION OF REPAYMENT CONTRACT. Effective upon conveyance under section 3, the Repayment Contract ends, and both the United States and the District are no longer obligated under it. SEC. 6. FORBEARANCE AGREEMENT. The United States has no payment obligation under paragraph 4(a) of the Forbearance Agreement after the Repayment Contract termination. All other terms of the Forbearance Agreement remain in effect for at least 10 years. SEC. 7. FUTURE BENEFITS. SEC. 7. FUTURE BENEFITS. Beginning on the conveyance date under section 3, no additional funds from the reclamation fund shall be provided for the conveyed land or facilities due to their status as part of a reclamation project.
